item.title: FNAF: Tower Defense Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
FNAF: Tower Defense is a well-made tower defense game with dynamic gameplay, lots of interesting maps, and game modes that makes it stand out from other similar Roblox experiences. The game is inspired by the popular Five Nights at Freddy's game series, but even if you're not a fan of that, it's still a great tower defense game that can keep you playing for hours.

By redeeming FNAF: Tower Defense codes, you will receive rewards from the developers that will help you progress in the game and survive in matches more easily. The rewards from the codes will be FazCoins, a currency that can be used to buy almost anything, so don't neglect it.

Updated October 11, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: We’ve double-checked the codes, and the good news is that they are still active. Don’t forget to redeem them before they expire.

All FNAF: Tower Defense Codes

Working FNAF: Tower Defense Codes

  • AbsolutelyWins! - Redeem this code to get 300 FazCoins.
  • 1kActive - Redeem this code to get 300 FazCoins.
  • please dont get a shadow skin - Redeem this code to get 1 Wild Crate.
  • LetsGoGambling - Redeem this code to get 1 Wild Crate.
  • SkinsGalore! - Redeem this code to get 3 Wild Crates.
  • 19k! - Redeem this code to get 500 FazCoins.
  • Unc RuleZ - Redeem this code to get 350 FazCoins.
  • Party Time! - Redeem this code to get 300 FazCoins.
  • NIGHTMARE - Redeem this code to get 300 FazCoins.
  • Dialtone - Redeem this code to get 250 FazCoins.

Expired FNAF: Tower Defense Codes

  • 1MVisits
  • 5KFaves
  • 5kMembers
  • Among us
  • Budget Cuts
  • DECADELONGUPDATE
  • Discord Update
  • Fnafmas2023
  • FNAFMASMIRACLE
  • Fractured Futures
  • FridayThe14th
  • NewLobby
  • PizzaRefund
  • Release
  • Scott45
  • SkinsGalore
  • ThanksFor2.5Million!!
  • ThanksFor2Mil!

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced player, redeeming FNAF: Tower Defense codes will be equally beneficial. With the rewards you receive, you can unlock new units much faster, so be sure to take advantage of this opportunity.

How to Redeem Codes in FNAF: Tower Defense

Redeeming FNAF: Tower Defense codes is not difficult, and a similar redemption system is often used in other Roblox games. However, you won't be able to do it as soon as you launch the game because to access the option, you'll first need to reach level 10, which will take several hours. Once that's done, here's a detailed guide on how to redeem FNAF: Tower Defense codes:

  • Launch FNAF: Tower Defense .
  • Pay attention to the bottom of the screen. There will be several buttons placed in a row. Interact with the second one, which says Codes.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a green Redeem button next to it. Now, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the green Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see "Success!" in the input field and the rewards will be credited to your account.

How to Get More FNAF: Tower Defense Codes

In addition to this page, you can find more Roblox codes by visiting the game's official social media. Here, along with other content, the developers often share codes, so be careful not to miss them:

  • Official FNAF: Tower Defense game page.
  • Official FNAF: Tower Defense Roblox group.
  • Official FNAF: Tower Defense Discord server.
  • Official FNAF: Tower Defense YouTube channel.
  • Official FNAF: Tower Defense X account.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Players Notice Glaring Issue With Van Der Linde Gun
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Red Dead Redemption 2 players question the authenticity of the Semi-Automatic Shotgun due to historical inaccuracy.
  • One player notes that the powerful firearm is based off of the Browning Auto-5, which wasn't produced until 1902, a few years after RDR2 takes place.
  • Despite the anachronism, the game's attention to detail and character performances earn high praise.

Observant Red Dead Redemption 2 players have raised an interesting issue regarding the Semi-Automatic Shotgun that the Van Der Linde gang use in the game and are wondering about its authenticity. Rockstar Games' Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of the highest-selling games of all time and has shipped more than 65 million copies worldwide since its launch in 2018. Packed full of highly detailed environments, meaningful encounters, and a slew of complex characters, many RDR2 players believe that the Wild Western title is deserving of every ounce of high praise it receives.

Even though there are plenty of hilarious moments to be found in Red Dead Redemption 2 , its narrative can also twist off into some of the saddest stories found in video games, which includes death, trauma, and deceit. Maybe more than anything, though, is how the game depicts an almost realistic world due to its amazing graphics and soulful character performances, but there seems to be one area of Red Dead Redemption 2 that doesn't seem to live up to its usual high standards for some players.

In a post on Reddit, user Accomplished_Dig3699 has shared with the Red Dead Redemption 2 community an issue they discovered that revolves around a gun the Van Der Linde gang has access to. The poster noticed that the Semi-Automatic Shotgun seemed very much out of place since the powerful firearm is based off of the Browning Auto-5, which wasn't produced until 1902, and much of Red Dead Redemption 2 is set in 1899, three years before the gun's release. Out of the array of incredibly powerful weapons in Red Dead Redemption 2 for players to take advantage of, guns seem to be one of the game's most popular choices, so it only stands to reason why some players might question their authenticity.

Red Dead Redemption 2 Players Spot Issue With the Semi-Automatic Shotgun

In the comment section, one Redditor states that the first semi-auto shotgun was invented and built in 1898, patented in 1900, and then mass-produced in 1902, so even though the gun isn't suitable for the game's timeline, the concept wasn't too far off. Another commentor expressed that "it's a video game and not an American history text book," meaning that Rockstar will take creative liberties when it comes to its weapons to make its gameplay more appealing. It's clear that the Semi-Automatic Shotgun is anachronistic for the game's time period, but aside from this, the Red Dead Redemption 2 gun is faithful to its real life counterpart.

The game packs an astonishing amount of detail, and even after six years since its release, players are still finding plenty of details, Easter eggs, and secrets hidden within Red Dead Redemption 2 's incredible world. Even though Rockstar is still focused on developing Grand Theft Auto 6 , a potential RDR2 sequel could be later down the line.

item.title: Sunderfolk Developers Talk Making The Game Accessible To Tabletop Newbies And Veterans Alike
item.description:
Board games and tabletop games are tons of fun, but can seem a little bit intimidating to newbies. They often feature elaborate rule sets and complex combat systems that can take some getting used to. When making Sunderfolk, a collaborative tactical RPG for mobile phones, developers Secret Door and Dreamhaven wanted to make a game that was simple enough for newbies to grasp but also appealed to DND veterans who love creating optimized builds and tackling tricky quests. The result, Sunderfolk, is a game that is straightforward to pick up but also has plenty of optimization and challenges.

Game Rant had the opportunity to both preview Sunderfolk and speak with its developers about the process of creating a game that can best be described as "Jackbox meets Dungeons and Dragons." The team emphasized that they wanted gamers of all levels to enjoy Sunderfolk, making it perfect for a family game night but also ideal for those who love a little bit of a challenge.

Sunderfolk Developers Wanted To Avoid The Need For Extensive Setup

The team at Secret Door are all big fans of board games and Dungeons and Dragons, and they wanted to create a game that brought to life their own experience adventuring together and hosting board game nights. However, they wanted to avoid the extensive manuals, complex setups, and math-heavy combat systems often associated with many board games.

Technical Director Chris Sigarty is a self-professed board game lover, but he acknowledged that it can be difficult to get non-enthusiasts, such as his own family members, to play games that require hours of setup, citing his personal favorite Gloomhaven as an example. He channeled those experiences into making Sunderfolk "easy and seamless" and "remov[ing]...barriers into getting into the game."

The Card-Based System Can Be Both Simple And Complex

Sunderfolk's UI focuses on presenting players with the information they need, and not overwhelming them. Combat is handled via a combination of card-based player skills and a randomized Fate Deck, which can provide bonuses or drawbacks. Weapons and trinkets are simple as well, adding straightforward bonuses that a character can generally activate in combat. However, players interested in more complex build optimization have opportunities to do this by selecting the right skill cards and items to use in various situations.

Game Director Erin Marek explained the philosophy behind Sunderfolk's card-based skill and battle system:

"Cards are very tactile...[and] easy to customize. They keep a nice, clean format for people being able to understand things...We wanted to make sure players had enough variety that [they] could actually spec differently."

Social Elements Are Allowed To Take Priority

The game's straightforward UI and systems mean that the social elements of playing a cooperative RPG together can come to the fore. Sunderfolk players can pause the game at any time, even during the heat of battle, to share stories or comment on the action. They can send each other messages and items via the Post Office, or steal treasure from one another in battle. Out of combat interactions focus on adorable animal NPCs who players can bond with, even getting the opportunity to name some of them themselves. Every aspect of the game contributes to creating a social-focused atmosphere of collaboration, humor, and bonding.

Sunderfolk promises to be a delightful introduction to the world of co-op RPGs for newbies, as well as a fun new experience for those with a lifetime of tabletop gaming under their belts. It can be the perfect choice for a family game night, a DND group taking a break between campaigns, a fun party icebreaker, and much more.

item.title: 8 Best Horror Games Based On Horror Movies
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Horror movies adapted into games create immersive experiences, making the scares even more terrifying.
  • Games like Alien: Isolation and Saw capture the essence of their movies, offering unique gameplay experiences.
  • From multiplayer dynamics to psychological terror, each adaptation brings the iconic horror universe to life.

Horror movies have always been a source of bone-chilling thrills. To provide fans with an even more immersive experience, a ton of these movies have been adapted into video games. Pitting players against the most iconic horror characters, these games do an incredible job of providing an adrenaline rush.

From going up against the mighty Freddy Krueger to being stalked by a Xenomorph, these horror adaptations capture the true essence of their movies. While the movies themselves get the adrenaline pumping, these games make the experience all the more terrifying. Here are the best horror games based on horror movies.

8 A Nightmare On Elm Street

Freddy’s Dream World Dangers

Platforms

NES

Released

October 1990

Developer

Rare

Genre

Platformer, Beat 'Em Up

While it has some flaws, the 1990 NES version of A Nightmare on Elm Street is a horror classic. Taking control of one of four teenagers, players have to gather Freddy Krueger's bones while staying awake. If they fall asleep, the nightmares begin.

This nightmare mechanic adds to the gameplay, making it interesting. To stay awake, players have to gather coffee beans scattered across the map. Despite complaints about the design and repetitive gameplay, this adaptation captures the truly unsettling nature of Freddy Krueger’s world.

7 Alien: Isolation

An Unsettling Stalker Experience

Based on the Alien franchise, Alien: Isolation expands on the story of the 1979 horror classic. Released in 2014, this game has its players take control of Amanda Ripley, the daughter of Ellen Ripley, who is stuck on a space station with a Xenomorph. The game's design and atmosphere create the feeling of isolation, nailing the movie's vibe.

On top of the creepy atmosphere, the Xenomorph's AI system allows it to learn the patterns of the player, making it unpredictable and all the more terrifying. When paired with the unsettling environment of the Sevastopol space station, this game becomes chilling enough to give anyone goosebumps.

6 Saw: The Video Game

Deadly Puzzles And Traps

Platforms

PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, PC

Released

October 6, 2009

Developer

Zombie Studios

Genre

Survival Horror, Puzzle

Released in 2009, Saw: The Video Game brought the Saw universe into the video game industry. Set between Saw and Saw 2 , this game allows players to step into the shoes of Detective David Tapp, exploring a creepy old asylum filled with Jigsaw's deadly traps. The game is all about solving puzzles and staying alive, creating a dark vibe similar to the movies.

Throughout the game's missions, players have to tackle gruesome traps and the tough choices that come with them. While it received mixed reviews for its fighting system and story, it brings in fantastic elements from the movies, making it a joy for horror fans.

5 Jaws Unleashed

Become The Apex Predator

Jaws Unleashed was a fun release back in 2006. In this game, players take control of the infamous Great White Shark from Steven Spielberg's film Jaws . The game is set thirty years after the movie, adding to the franchise's lore. While the game doesn't have much story to it, it's great for casually wreaking havoc.

Players move around different locations, such as beaches and amusement parks, where they cause mayhem for unsuspecting swimmers and boats alike. In the game, there are various kinds of tasks, including those that are driven by stories and others that allow players to move around freely and explore the open world. That said, there are a few bugs and camera problems that make the experience a bit less enjoyable.

4 Evil Dead: The Game

Cooperative Horror And Action

In 2022, Evil Dead: The Game was launched, merging some parts of Sam Raimi's famous Evil Dead series with cooperative gameplay. Several roles are available for gamers to take on, each from different timelines. For instance, Ash Williams and his friends, as they battle with the Deadites to get the Necronomicon back.

The game has a story mode as well as a multiplayer mode, where players can work together to fight against enemies. By using the weapons and abilities that are specific to each character and all taken from the films, players can make the game's combat more exciting and employ various strategies during battles.

3 Blair Witch

Psychological Horror In The Woods

This psychological horror was released in 2019, taking inspiration from The Blair Witch Project , a film that changed the horror genre completely by introducing the concept of "found footage.". Players take on the role of a former police officer, Ellis Lynch, who has to find a missing child. To do so, he has to go into an ominous and strange area of the woods.

Players explore creepy supernatural environments with the help of Bullet, their faithful canine companion. Bullet, the AI dog, is super important to the game. He helps find items and warns about potential dangers — all of which make for some affecting moments as players bond with him throughout the game. Blair Witch has different endings that depend on the choices made with Bullet. Overall, the game does a great job of adapting one of the best horror movies of the modern era into an enjoyable gaming experience.

2 The Texas Chain Saw Massacre

Killer-Victim Multiplayer Dynamic

The Texas Chain Saw Massacre is an online multiplayer horror game released in 2023. As in the original film, one group of players takes on the role of the killers, while another tries to survive. On top of that, players can decide whether they want to play as members of the Sawyer family or as one of their victims.

The game does a great job of creating an unsettling environment like the one seen in the movie. From an anxiety-inducing atmosphere to the cat-and-mouse gameplay, this adaptation truly captures the essence of the movies. While it was met with mixed reviews upon release, the game offers a unique experience for fans looking to immerse themselves in the eerie universe of the franchise.

1 Friday The 13th: The Game

Iconic Slasher Survival Experience

Friday the 13th: The Game is a multiplayer survival horror game that was released in 2017. In this game, players can choose to be a camp counselor trying to survive, or Jason Voorhees himself. The developers did a great job of creating an immersive experience that will appeal to all slasher fans.

Players need to work together to live through Jason's never-ending attacks by hiding and using different items found around the camp. The game has more than one map, and each one is based on the movies. Players also get to play as many different versions of Jason from different movie installments. Even though it was taken down from digital stores due to some legal issues, the game is still regarded as one of the best slashers in the horror genre.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077's Modding Community Proves One Feature May Be Make or Break for a Sequel
item.description:
Since its 2020 launch, Cyberpunk 2077 has gone through many transformations and updates that have helped it become one of the strongest RPGs around. With game-changing DLC in Phantom Liberty and a variety of quality of life upgrades, Cyberpunk 2077 continues to draw players into the cutthroat metropolis of Night City.

The work of developer CD Projekt Red has been responsible for many of these great updates, but the game's modding community definitely can't go overlooked. There is a vast variety of Cyberpunk 2077 mod options for players to choose from, but one of the most groundbreaking yet comes from a modder known as Tylerrrr. On Nexus, Tylerrrr's creation, titled "Every Animation Redone TPP Third Person", brings an incredibly impressive third-person perspective to life in the game. The mod allows players to experience the game in a brand-new light, and its well-crafted nature raises a compelling argument for CD Projekt Red to add third-person to Cyberpunk 2077 's sequel.

Cyberpunk 2077's Sequel Could Greatly Benefit From a Third-Person Perspective

Bringing More Options to Project Orion

As of now, the codename for Cyberpunk 2077 's sequel is Project Orion. Much of the sequel remains a mystery, but it can be assumed that CD Projekt Red will strive to make Project Orion an even stronger experience than its predecessor. One of the best ways to make Project Orion exceed expectations is to bring a third-person option into the game.

Mods like Tylerrrr's third-person camera not only showcase the talent of the game's modding community, but it also demonstrates the desire for such a perspective to be featured in the game. At the time of this writing, the mod has received over 13,000 downloads, and that number is likely to grow. The mod was uploaded on September 29, so that's a significant number of downloads in just a few weeks. The high expectations for Project Orion put the game in a tough position, but the confirmation of bringing a third-person view to the game would immediately be praised by many members of the fan base.

A canceled Cyberpunk 2077 DLC set on the moon has ignited rumors about this setting being used for Project Orion. It's unclear if the sequel will completely move away from Night City.

Project Orion Setting Itself Apart From Cyberpunk 2077

Improving On Cyberpunk 2077's Mistakes

Project Orion will hopefully feature an even richer world compared to Cyberpunk 2077 . Immersion is a major focus of Cyberpunk 2077 , which makes the first-person view understandable. Being up close and personal with everything featured in Night City is a simple way to truly make players feel as though they're in the shoes of their character. However, not allowing players to choose how they experience the world of Cyberpunk 2077 can also have downsides.

A third-person camera angle can show more of a character's surrounding environment, which can still bring plenty of immersion, even if it's not close up. With much of Project Orion being unknown, it's intriguing to speculate about what the sequel will feature, and allowing players to choose how they are immersed in Night City could be more effective overall.

Project Orion was first announced in 2022, but active development on the sequel didn't start until earlier this year.

There are many who love Cyberpunk 2077 's first-person approach, but offering more choices to players would likely only increase excitement for a follow-up chapter. Rumors about Project Orion have been circulating nonstop since it was first confirmed. It will likely be a while before CD Projekt Red offers more insight into the sequel, but whenever more news comes to light, there will hopefully be an update regarding possible camera perspectives.
